newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venepal ups capital, sets shr div. [CORRECTED 22:54 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Venepal ups capital, sets shr div. [CORRECTED 22:54 GMT]

text.p: Leading Venezuelan paper company Venepal will increase its paid-up capital by up to 60 billion bolivars ($128 million) with a new issue of Class B shares through its global depository receipts (GDR), the company said.
At an extraordinary shareholders' meeting the company also agreed to a share dividend of both its A and B shares, and to a possible Euronote issue of up to eight billion bolivars ($17 million).
(Corrects to say company set a share dividend).
The note will be used to roll over six million bolivars of debt due to mature on October 31 and December 5, the company said in a press release.
